A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: The Last Jedi is entertaining at times and the growth of the Star Wars Universe is exciting for any life-long Star Wars fan. However\, the forced (no pun intended) comic relief was an unfortunate capitulation to the current movie trends on the part of Disney/Johnson. Comic relief can be good\, but I cannot believe how poorly it was used in this movie (see original Trilogy for how it can work effectively). \n\nThis movie felt like Disney/Johnson have never seen a previous Star Wars film. They are certainly not bound by the past (and they shouldn't be) and I looked forward to where they would innovate and take the Star Wars Universe. However\, they ought to be bound by who a character fundamentally is. At the very least\, significant work must be done from a character development perspective to fill the void left by a fundamental change. I'm talking about Luke's character here most especially. He is portrayed as someone wholly different. There was zero character development and the limited effort thay was made for a back story wasn't terribly believable. Critics may appreciate that it is real and raw to portray him as a flawed character\, but that is something different from changing what makes him Luke Skywalker. It's really unfortunate and harms the larger Arc of the Star Wars saga.
